headline.main: New York Senate Passes Bill on Medical Marijuana

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to sign the bill, which would be effective immediately, though the bill’s regulations and implementation could take up to 18 months.
docs.snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to sign the bill, which would be effective immediately, though the bill’s regulations and implementation could take up to 18 months.

headline.print_headline: Cuomo and Top Legislators Reach a Deal to Allow Marijuana for Medical Use
headline.main: New York Leaders Reach Deal on Medical Marijuana

docs.abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and legislative leaders announce agreement for pilot program to provide access to marijuana to sick New Yorkers; agreement makes state one of the largest to embrace drug's use as medicine; agreement includes demand from Cuomo's administration that no smoking of the drug will be permitted.
docs.lead_paragraph: The agreement includes a major demand of the Cuomo administration: that no smoking of the drug would be permitted, though other options would be.
docs.snippet: The agreement includes a major demand of the Cuomo administration: that no smoking of the drug would be permitted, though other options would be.

headline.print_headline: Big Tobacco Squares Up as EU Rules Aim to Track Every Cigarette
headline.main: Big Tobacco Squares Up as EU Rules Aim to Track Every Cigarette

docs.lead_paragraph: It takes a British American Tobacco factory machine three minutes to load 4 million cigarettes onto a truck in northern Bavaria - but it can take a lot longer to figure out whether those cigarettes end up where they should.
docs.snippet: It takes a British American Tobacco factory machine three minutes to load 4 million cigarettes onto a truck in northern Bavaria - but it can take a lot longer to figure out whether those cigarettes end up where they should.
